description:
Currently, the functions in fake_network_cache_model all default to building a fake ipv4 network, and so the easiest way to test against a fake ipv6 network is to manually create ipv6 components (subnets, routes, ips) and plug them into the default fake VIF.  This makes testing ipv6 functionality rather error-prone and laborious.

There should be some option in the fake_network_cache_model functions that creates ipv6 models instead of ipv4 models.
title: fake_network_cache_model doesn't support ipv6

comments.content:
Currently, the functions in fake_network_cache_model all default to building a fake ipv4 network, and so the easiest way to test against a fake ipv6 network is to manually create ipv6 components (subnets, routes, ips) and plug them into the default fake VIF.  This makes testing ipv6 functionality rather error-prone and laborious.

There should be some option in the fake_network_cache_model functions that creates ipv6 models instead of ipv4 models.

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/143755
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=93a22d47025f8e3eb9363077093012a801e5160c
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 93a22d47025f8e3eb9363077093012a801e5160c
Author: Ellen Hui <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jul 1 16:52:22 2014 +0000

    Add ipv6 support to fake network models
    
    Currently, the functions in fake_network_cache_model all default to
    building a fake ipv4 network, and so the easiest way to test against a
    fake ipv6 network is to manually create ipv6 components (subnets,
    routes, ips) and plug them into the default fake VIF. This makes testing
    ipv6 functionality rather error-prone and laborious.
    
    This patch adds an option to create ipv6 models.
    
    Change-Id: I9aacbc45ce79cab05c6611d38fc2daaf2ba5dab7
    Co-Authored-By: Ellen Hui <email address hidden>
    Closes-Bug: #1336094
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
